dt: {bc}one attached to another by {d_link|affection|affection} or esteem

dt.t: Is he a {wi}friend{/wi} or an enemy?

dt: {bc}one that is of the same nation, party, or group
{bc}one that {d_link|favors|favor:2} or promotes something (such as a charity)

dt.t: this trend has alarmed {wi}friends{/wi} of the liberal arts
The {wi}friends{/wi} of the library will host a fund-raiser.

dt: {bc}a member of a Christian sect that stresses Inner Light, rejects sacraments and an ordained ministry, and opposes war

quotes.t: Over the last couple of years I have experienced moments of disbelief when I meet my {qword}friends{/qword} in public. They look older than I think they should.
… she … got a job, made {qword}friends{/qword} and managed to write a novel that hit the best-seller lists and stayed there …
Never had a {qword}friend{/qword} like that before or since. Never laughed so hard in my life as I did with Manny.

et: Middle English {it}frend{/it}, from Old English {it}frēond{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}friunt{/it} friend, Old English {it}frēon{/it} to love, {it}frēo{/it} free
shortdef: one attached to another by affection or esteem

dt: {bc}to include (someone) in a list of designated {a_link|friends} on a person's social networking site

shortdef: to act as the friend of : befriend
to include (someone) in a list of designated friends on a person's social networking site

dt: {bc}a friend with whom one has casual sexual relations without commitments

shortdef: a friend with whom one has casual sexual relations without commitments

dt: {bc}a person admitted to or appointed by a court to act for the benefit of a person (such as an infant) lacking full legal capacity

shortdef: a person admitted to or appointed by a court to act for the benefit of a person (such as an infant) lacking full legal capacity

meta.id: a friend in need is a friend indeed

dt: used to say that a friend who will help someone when help is needed is a true friend

shortdef: —used to say that a friend who will help someone when help is needed is a true friend

dt.t: We have been {phrase}best friends{/phrase} since high school.

dt: {bc}a friend that a person had when both of them were children {bc}a friend since childhood

shortdef: a friend that a person had when both of them were children : a friend since childhood

dt: {bc}a person who has known and spent time with one's family

shortdef: a person who has known and spent time with one's family

dt: {bc}a friend with whom one is not in a romantic relationship when one might possibly be

dt.t: Sara and Joe say they are {phrase}just friends{/phrase}.
